summary:
Yōkai are mysterious creatures in Japanese folklore, often described as spirits or ghosts. The word "yōkai" means "strange apparition." They can look like animals, humans, or objects, and some can even change shape. These beings might be friendly or mischievous, and some have special powers. Examples include the turtle-like Kappa and the winged Tengu.

During the Edo period, artists created new yōkai, making them a unique part of Japanese culture. Many people today still enjoy learning about and imagining these fascinating creatures.
title: Yōkai
